attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Pokémon SP and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Team Attack
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokémon SP you have in play.

data.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Claw Snag
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Weavile from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. Choose a card from your opponent's hand and discard it.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

data.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Dark Engage
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Each of your Active Pokémon's type is Darkness until the end of your turn. If that Pokémon is no longer your Active Pokémon, this effect ends.

attacks.name: Shadow Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Darkness Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Chip Off
attacks.text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.

data.flavorText: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

data.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Tear Away
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon into your hand.

data.flavorText: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Vilify
attacks.text: Discard as many Pokémon as you like from your hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Pokémon you discarded.

data.flavorText: They communicate by clawing signs in boulders and work together to surround enemies.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Dark Penalty
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has no Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Evil Admonition
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon that has an Ability.

data.flavorText: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon's main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Rule of Evil
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to each Pokémon that has an Ability (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

data.name: Weavile-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadow Connection
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Darkness Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nocturnal Maneuvers-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Two-Hit KO
attacks.text: During your next turn, if the Defending Pokémon is damaged by an attack from a Rapid Strike Pokémon, it will be Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Ransack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is heads, your opponent reveals their hand. For each heads, choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of your opponent's deck in any order.

data.flavorText: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.

data.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Pursuit Claw
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each damage counter on that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.

data.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Assaulting Hunt
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon to the Active Spot.

data.flavorText: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

data.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Assaulting Hunt
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon to the Active Spot.

data.flavorText: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

attacks.name: Hail Claw
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
